ZOYA, by Danielle Steel. (Delacorte, $19.95.) One woman's story, from St.
Petersburg during the Russian Revolution to Paris in the 1920's to contemporary
New York.
LOVE IN THE TIME OF CHOLERA, by Gabriel Garcia Marquez. (Knopf, $18.95.)
A Colombian poet's perdurable love for a woman is tested by life's changing
conditions.
THE ICARUS AGENDA, by Robert Ludlum. (Random House, $19.95.) A
congressman's secret dealings with terrorists may bring him the Presidency - or
death.
THE BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES, by Tom Wolfe. (Farrar, Straus & Giroux,

The experiences of President Reagan's former Treasury Secretary and chief of
staff.

TALKING STRAIGHT, by Lee Iacocca with Sonny Kleinfield. (Bantam, $21.95.)

MOONWALK, by Michael Jackson. (Doubleday, $15.95.) The autobiography of the
